December 2024

  • 12/30/2024 –Signing of Historic Interagency Agreement fully obligates all Navajo Nation Fiscal Recovery Funds
  • 12/30/2024 –Arbin Mitchell sworn in as District 6 Council Delegate
  • 12/26/2024 –Law and Order Committee approves $34.25 million for judicial infrastructure, strengthens emergency response coordination
  • 12/25/2024 –The 25th Navajo Nation Council embraces kinship and harmony during the Késhmish season
  • 12/23/2024 –American Relief Act secures extension and additional funding for the Navajo-Gallup Water Supply Project
  • 12/20/2024 –Budget and Finance Committee advanced key legislation for vital records services and judicial infrastructure
  • 12/18/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council passes emergency legislation to ensure continuity of chapter leadership
  • 12/17/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council approves legislation to prevent the reversion of APRA funds
  • 12/17/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council celebrates Diné College 2024 Fall Commencement
  • 12/16/2024 –Festive Christmas tree lighting fills People’s House with holiday spirit and cheer
  • 12/16/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council celebrates Yá’át’ééh Késhmish with NAOMI House
  • 12/16/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council approves legislation to remove Navajo Nation Attorney General Ethel Branch
  • 12/15/2024 –Naabik’íyáti’ Committee discusses the budget, recruitment, and future leadership plans of the Navajo Nation’s Youth Advisory Council
  • 12/13/2024 –Naabik’íyáti’ Committee takes action to rescind outdated roadway buffer zone regulations
  • 12/13/2024 –Council Delegate Steven R. Arviso applauds allocation of $10 million for Mariano Lake Chapter multipurpose building
  • 12/11/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council congratulates Arbin Mitchell, newly elected Council Delegate for District 6
  • 12/11/2024 –Resources & Development Committee unanimously approves key land lease for Pueblo Pintado Health Center
  • 12/10/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council focus on critical strategies to address public safety at Dine’ Action Plan Winter Session
  • 12/10/2024 –Speaker Crystalyne Curley visits Navajo Veteran’s homesite
  • 12/06/2024 –Eastern Navajo Land Commission reviews NHPA Agreement and land status for Navajo Code Talker Museum Project
  • 12/06/2024 –New Mexico Caucus vets New Mexico Infrastructure Capital Improvement Plan and Capital Outlay Projects
  • 12/06/2024 –Office of the Navajo Nation Human Rights Commission is Closed
  • 12/06/2024 –Health, Education and Human Services Committee address procurement delays and elder care gaps
  • 12/03/2024 –Law and Order Committee meets with local leadership to discuss public safety infrastructure

November 2024

  • 11/28/2024 –Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee receives financial report for 76th Navajo Nation Fair
  • 11/26/2024 –Law and Order Committee Chair calls for urgent action on Missing and Murdered Indigenous People crisis
  • 11/26/2024 –Happy Thanksgiving from the 25th Navajo Nation Council
  • 11/26/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council reassures farmers and ranchers that crop insurance benefits are secure
  • 11/23/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council Delegates advocate for protection of sacred ceremonies and medicines
  • 11/21/2024 –Navajo Nation Council advocates for justice reform and stronger collaboration with federal partners
  • 11/21/2024 –Navajo Nation takes Horsemen Lodge land into trust, expanding economic opportunities to benefit relocatees
  • 11/19/2024 –Tribal Interior Budget Committee’s Public Safety and Justice Subcommittee addresses Tribal Law Enforcement challenges
  • 11/15/2024 –Resources and Development Committee conducts site tour to focus on reclamation, asset security, and community development
  • 11/14/2024 –Navajo Nation files second lawsuit against Apache County to protect Navajo voting rights
  • 11/13/2024 –Health, Education, and Human Services Committee receives update on wage adjustments, policy updates, and hiring enhancements
  • 11/13/2024 –Navajo Nation leaders urge Congress to pass water rights bills
  • 11/12/2024 –Resources and Development Committee discusses freight rail feasibility study, receives $1 million dividend check
  • 11/11/2024 – Legislation signed to fund rebuild of Hogback Pumping Station and rehabilitation of Chinle Valley Irrigation Well
  • 11/11/2024 – Navajo Nation strengthens Tobacco Tax to address addiction and curb youth usage of nicotine products
  • 11/08/2024 –Navajo Nation Environmental Remediation Fund ensures the protection and longevity of Navajo lands
  • 11/07/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council Standing Committees host special meeting to address community involvement and public safety
  • 11/07/2024 – Navajo Nation Council joins President Nygren in signing a $148 million legislation to improve all Navajo Nation senior centers
  • 11/05/2024 –Navajo Nation files lawsuit to extend voting hours in Apache County

October 2024

  • 10/31/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council approves amendment to expand Fiscal Recovery Fund usage for bathroom renovations/upgrades
  • 10/30/2024 –  Nast’aji’ Nahata’ Hane Legislative Branch News – 2024 Fall Session
  • 10/29/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council approves emergency funding for 2024 General Election
  • 10/29/2024 – Navajo Nation Council confirms Michelle Espino as Chief Legislative Counsel
  • 10/28/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council approves Legislation 0149-24 establishing Environmental Remediation Fund 
  • 10/25/2024 –Arizona Treasurer Kimberly Yee Announces Historic Partnership with the Chilchinbeto Chapter of the Navajo Nation
  • 10/25/2024 – President Biden offers formal apology for the treatment of Native American children during the boarding school era
  • 10/24/2024 –25th Navajo Nation Council appropriates approximately $148 Million for construction and renovation of senior centers across the Navajo Nation
  • 10/24/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council passes legislation to amend tobacco tax to
    include nicotine and electronic smoking products
  • 10/23/2024 – In President Nygren’s absence, Vice President Montoya provides the State of the Navajo Nation Address
  • 10/23/2024 –Council Delegate Amber Kanazbah Crotty honors Sally Pete for her dedication to Navajo healthcare
  • 10/23/2024 – Council Delegates recognize achievements and contributions of community leaders and student athletes
  • 10/22/2024 –Navajo Nation Council unites to advocate for Domestic Violence and Disability Awareness
  • 10/22/2024 –2024 Fall Session Speaker’s Report address key issues and initiatives
  • 10/20/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council to convene on Monday, Oct. 21 for the 2024 Fall Council Session
  • 10/19/2024 – Navajo Code Talker John Kinsel, Sr. passes away at 107 years old
  • 10/16/2024 – Navajo Nation Council advocates for Navajo students and families at New Mexico Government to Government Indian Education Summit
  • 10/16/2024 – MMDR Task Force calls for systemic reforms and federal accountability at Tuba City Boarding School
  • 10/16/2024 – Resources and Development Committee holds work session on the Navajo Nation Road Fund Management Plan and regulations
  • 10/14/2024 – Naabik’íyáti’ Committee supports legislation for $148 million for senior centers
  • 10/14/2024 – The 25th Navajo Nation Council stands with Indigenous Nations in celebrating Indigenous Peoples’ Day
  • 10/11/2024 – Naabik’iyati’ Committee addresses key health and senior care initiatives with the Navajo Department of Health
  • 10/10/2024 – Naabik’iyati’ Committee discusses project updates for E911 and Rural Addressing Project
  • 10/09/2024 – Resources and Development Committee requests further consultation before implementation of new Eastern Agency Grazing Permit Renewal Grazing Fees
  • 10/07/2024 – Law and Order Committee recommends permanent appointment for probationary judges
  • 10/03/2024 – Council Delegate Amber Kanazbah Crotty joins community rally calling for justice and accountability at Tuba City Boarding School
  • 10/01/2024 – Navajo Nation Council questions President Nygren’s use of the line item veto authority

September 2024

  • 09/30/2024 – Council Delegate Lomardo Aseret steps down as a member of the 25th Navajo Nation Council
  • 09/30/2024 – Navajo Nation Board of Election Supervisors provides report on resolution disqualifying candidates from the 2024 Navajo Nation General Election
  • 09/30/2024 – Naabik’iyati’ passes legislation to amend tobacco tax to include electronic smoking and nicotine products
  • 09/26/2024 – New Mexico Caucus meets to establish Navajo priorities in New Mexico
  • 09/26/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council urges President Nygren to take action on a proposed Continuing Resolution
  • 09/25/2024 – Tribal leaders present united voice in support of water rights
  • 09/24/2024 – Speaker Curley, former uranium miners, and downwinders urge Speaker Johnson to bring RECA extension to a vote
  • 09/23/2024 – U.S. Sens. Heinrich, Lujan introduce Rio San Jose Stream System Water Rights Settlement Act, companion bill to H.R. 8945 introduced by U.S. Rep. Leger Fernandez in the House on July 9
  • 09/23/2024 – Budget and Finance Committee passes Nicotine Tax Legislation extending tax to cover non-tobacco nicotine products
  • 09/23/2024 – Resources and Development Committee approves Right of Way to move Northern Navajo Agency road improvement projects forward
  • 09/20/2024 – Missing and Murdered Dine’ Relatives Task Force Chair Amber Kanazbah Crotty receives Vanguard of Justice Award
  • 09/17/2024 – Missing and Murdered Dine’ Relatives Task Force discusses report from BIA Missing and Murdered Unit
  • 09/17/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council celebrates groundbreaking of long-awaited loop road improvement project
  • 09/16/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council unanimously supports continued government operations with passage of Continuing Resolution
  • 09/13/2024 – Six-month Continuing Resolution for FY2025 to be considered during special session
  • 09/11/2024 – Health, Education and Human Services Committee pushes broadband and telecommunications expansion for improved public safety and economic development
  • 09/11/2024 – Law and Order Committee advances a legislation proposing a referendum on changing the official name from Navajo Nation to Dine’ Nation
  • 09/10/2024 – Speaker Curley advocates for the Navajo Nation at the Department of the Interior Secretary’s Tribal Advisory Committee meeting
  • 09/03/2024 – Navajo Nation Council to seek special budget session to consider Continuing Resolution

August 2024

  • 08/31/2024 – Budget and Finance Committee concludes Fiscal Year 2025 Comprehensive Budget public hearings
  • 08/30/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council joins President Nygren in signing legislation to strengthen opposition to uranium transportation
  • 08/29/2024 – Navajo Nation Council passes legislation supporting internship program in Washington, D.C.
  • 08/28/2024 – Missing and Murdered Dine’ Relatives Task Force enhance law enforcement collaboration and community support
  • 08/27/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council passes legislation strengthening protections against radioactive material
  • 08/27/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council approves a $737,800 funding allocation from the Navajo Nation Fair Fund
  • 08/23/2024 – Navajo educational stakeholders address critical challenges at Dine’ Bi’ Olta School Board Association Forum
  • 08/19/2024 – Budget and Finance Committee holds the FY25 Comprehensive Budget Public Hearing in Western Navajo Agency
  • 08/16/2024 – Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee questions timeline to access Revenue Replacement Funds
  • 08/15/2024 – Budget and Finance Committee continues FY2025 Comprehensive Budget Public Hearings in the Fort Defiance Navajo Agency
  • 08/14/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council commemorates Navajo Code Talkers Day
  • 08/13/2024 – Budget and Finance Committee commences Public Hearings on Fiscal Year 2025 Comprehensive Budget
  • 08/12/2024 – Missing and Murdered Dine’ Relatives Task Force receives report from the Navajo Nation Victim Witness Advocacy Program
  • 08/07/2024 – Budget and Finance Committee to host public hearings on the Fiscal Year 2025 Comprehensive Budget
  • 08/06/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council advocates at the Tribal Interior Budget Council meeting
  • 08/01/2024 – Law and Order Committee advocates for increased Public Safety and Justice budgets

July 2024

  • 07/30/2024 – JOINT PRESS RELEASE: Navajo Nation President Buu Nygren, Navajo Nation Council Speaker Crystalyne Curley condemn today’s unauthorized transport of uranium ore through Nation
  • 07/24/2024 – Tribal leaders present unified voice in support of Arizona water rights
  • 07/19/2024 – Navajo leaders welcome Bureau of Reclamation Commissioner to the Navajo Nation
  • 07/19/2024 – Council Delegate Brenda Jesus brings the community together for the 2nd Annual Veterans Mental Health Awareness 5K Run and Walk
  • 07/18/2024 – 25th Navajo Nation Council continues offering support for Missing and Murdered Dine’ Relatives
  • 07/17/2024 – Northeastern Arizona Indian Water Rights Settlement Agreement provides more than water to Arizona Tribes
  • 07/16/2024 – Council Delegates and advocates raise awareness about drunk driving on the first day of the Summer Session
  • 07/16/2024 – Media Advisory:  Navajo Nation, Hopi Tribe and San Juan Southern Paiute Tribe signing ceremony for Historic Water Settlement
  • 07/15/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council calls on President Nygren for State of the Navajo Nation Address
  • 07/15/2024 –  Summer Council Session recesses until Tuesday morning
  • 07/15/2024 –  Navajo Nation Council Speaker Crystalyne Curley’s Quarterly Report to the Navajo Nation Council’s 2024 Summer Session (Revised on 07/16/2024)
  • 07/12/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council convenes for 2024 Summer Council Session on July 15
  • 07/09/2024 –  Law and Order Committee receives report from Division of Public Safety Director Anderson
  • 07/08/2024 –  Media Advisory: Virtual press conference regarding the introduction of House and Senate bills to approve Northeastern Indian Water Rights Settlement
  • 07/08/2024 –  Navajo Water Rights Legislation introduced in Congress
  • 07/04/2024 –  Former Human Resources Division Director delivers exit report to the Health, Education and Human Services Committee
  • 07/01/2024 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee receives a report from the Department of Emergency Management regarding severe rainstorm response efforts
  • 07/01/2024 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee considers confirmation of Navajo Department of Health Director
  • 07/01/2024 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee approves Gamerco site for the location of new Gallup Indian Medical Center

  • 06/26/2024 –  Majority of Navajo Nation Chapters approve optional virtual attendance at Chapter meetings
  • 06/26/2024 –  Grand opening of the Ganado Senior and Veterans Center marks a new era of community support
  • 06/25/2024 –  Feral horse problem discussed in report to the Resources and Development Committee
  • 06/20/2024 –  Law and Order Committee receives FY2025 budget update from the Office of Hearings and Appeals
  • 06/19/2024 –  Speaker Curley addressses public safety and capital outlay priorities at the New Mexico State Tribal Leaders Summit
  • 06/17/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council celebrates the grand opening of the tribe’s Goulding’s Lodge
  • 06/17/2024 –  Speaker Curley thanks Foster Grandparent Volunteers for their love and compassion
  • 06/17/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council mourns the passing of Criminal Investigator Rodger J. Yazzie
  • 06/17/2024 –  Resources and Development Committee hears report on high-pressure slurry ablation treatment
  • 06/13/2024 –  Budget and Finance Committee supports $2.2 million appropriation for summer youth employment
  • 06/13/2024 –  Speaker Curley pushes for infrastructure and water needs in roundtable discussion with House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries and key congressional leaders
  • 06/12/2024 –  Advisory group convenes to strengthen Dine’ Action Plan
  • 06/12/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council honors the service of all Women Veterans
  • 06/07/2024 –  Navajo Nation Council acts to protect Navajo Nation ARPA funds from federal ‘claw back’
  • 06/07/2024 –  Council members address clean energy initiatives at the 2024 Navajo Nation Energy Summit
  • 06/05/2024 –  Navajo Nation, Hopi Tribe and Southern San Juan Paiute leaders advocate for Arizona water rights with Congressional members
  • 06/03/2024 –  Navajo Nation voices strong support for S.3853, the Radiation Exposure Compensation Reauthorization Act
  • 06/03/2024 –  Resources and Development Committee approves two appointments to the NTUA Board of Directors

May 2024

  • 05/23/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council unanimously approves Northeastern Arizona Indian Water Rights Settlement Agreement for all Colorado River water in Arizona
  • 05/23/2024 –  Press Conference:  The 25th Navajo Nation Council approves the historic Arizona and New Mexico Water Rights Settlements
  • 05/22/2024 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee unanimously approves Northeastern Arizona Indian Water Rights Settlement Agreement for all Colorado River water in Arizona
  • 05/22/2024 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee unanimously supports the Rio San Jose’ Water Rights Settlement Agreement, moves forward to Council
  • 05/22/2024 –  Resources and Development Committee calls on US EPA to provide further public outreach on Eastern Agency Abandon Uranium Mine remediation
  • 05/22/2024 –  Council members continue advocating for justice for victims of fraudulent sober living homes
  • 05/21/2024 –  Law and Order Committee calls on Congress to strengthen support for public safety on the Navajo Nation
  • 05/17/2024 –  Speaker Curley pushes for essential amendments to Radiation Exposure Compensation Act
  • 05/17/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council demands respect for Indigenous graduates
  • 05/15/2024 –  Resources and Development Committee advocates community development and telecommunications advancements
  • 05/14/2024 –  Navajo Nation agreement to settle all water rights claims in Arizona up for approval by Navajo Nation Council
  • 05/14/2024 –  Navajo Nation settlement for water claims in the Rio San Jose’, Rio Puerco Basins in New Mexico up for consideration by the Navajo Nation Council
  • 05/13/2024 –  Resources and Development Committee discusses agriculture initiatives and farm plot utilization
  • 05/11/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council celebrates the 2024 Spring Commencement of Navajo Technical University
  • 05/10/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council recognizes Navajo Nation Police Officer Day
  • 05/09/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council marches for awareness of Missing and Murdered Dine’ Relatives
  • 05/08/2024 –  Law and Order Committee announces updated appointments to the Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee’s Title II Reform Subcommittee
  • 05/07/2024 –  Missing and Murdered Dine’ Relatives Task Force highlights urgent issues on Misssing and Murdered Indigenous People’s Day
  • 05/06/2024 –  HEHSC advances ADA compliance with key initiatives and allocated funding
  • 05/06/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council mourns the passing of former Delegate Joe M. Lee
  • 05/03/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council joins President Nygren in signing a resolution bringing water infrastructure to Kin Dah Lichii Chapter
  • 05/02/2024 –  Navajo Nation and federal law enforcement arrest alleged Cameron shooter
  • 05/02/2024 –  Reycita Billie honored by the U.S. Department of Justice for outstanding contributions to public safety

  • 03/29/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council recognizes National Vietnam War Veterans Day

  • 02/29/2024 –  Law & Order Committee addresses community safety concerns at Whitehorse High School Public Hearing

  • 02/20/2024 –  Resources & Development Committee approves historic Navajo Nation Burial and Cemetary Regulations
  • 02/15/2024 –  Speaker Curley offers support for AHCCCS reforms to address fraudulent sober living homes

  • 02/05/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council advocate for Navajo priority issues with New Mexico Governor, legislators, and agencies
  • 02/01/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council applauds signing of $6 million emergency relief resolution to mitigate impacts of winter weather
  • 02/01/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council passes resolution support the proposed New Mexico Indian Education Trust Fund and calling for equity in the makeup of the funding task force

  • 01/30/2024 –  Nast’aji’ Nahata’ Hane Legislative Branch News – 2024 Winter Session

  • 01/23/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council approves $500,000 to assist with the construction of a new higher education facility

  • 01/12/2024 –  25th Navajo Nation Council members speak in support of road funding, traditional healing services, and voting rights measures with Utah State lawmakers

DECEMBER 2023

  • 12/29/2023 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee approves legislation to override Presidential veto of virtual attendance resolution
  • 12/29/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council honors the life of Dine’ Vietnam War veteran Daniel H. Yazza
  • 12/28/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council pays tribute to the life of former Council Delegate J.C. Begay
  • 12/14/2023 –  MMDR Task Force hears report on New Mexico MMIP State Response Plan
  • 12/14/2023 –  Law & Order Committee hears reports from Navajo Nation Labor Commission, Office of Hearings and Appeals, and Ethics and Rules Office
  • 12/14/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council participate in Dine’ Action Plan Advisory Group
  • 12/11/2023 – Vice Chair Slater said IHS is Indian Country’s fundamental support system
  • 12/09/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council congratulates Dine’ College graduates
  • 12/08/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council mourns the passing of former Council Delegate Dean Paul, Sr.
  • 12/08/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council pays tribute to the life of former Council Delegate Freddie Howard
  • 12/08/2023 – Joint statement by President Dr. Buu Nygren of the Navajo Nation & Speaker Crystalyne Curley of the 25th Navajo Nation Council
  • 12/07/2023 – Speaker Curley advocates for the Navajo Nation at the Department of the Interior Secretary’s Tribal Advisory Committee meeting
  • 12/07/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council mourns the passing of Navajo Nation Police Sgt. Kara Tilden
  • 12/06/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council Delegate testifies on National Parks Air Tour Management Program impacts before House subcommittee
  • 12/05/2023 – Speaker Curley advocates for workforce development solutions with U.S. Secretary of Labor Su 
  • 12/01/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council honors the life of the first woman Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day O’Connor

NOVEMBER 2023

  • 11/28/2023 –  HEHSC Chairperson Vince James addresses Navajo health priorities at the Indian Health Services FY2026 Budget Formulation Tribal Consultation
  • 11/24/2023 – Resources and Development Committee discuss proposed Navajo grazing, range management, and grazing permit initiatives
  • 11/22/2023 – Budget and Finance Committee questions progress of Navajo Veterans Administration Housing Program
  • 11/22/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council meets with newly-appointed acting Navajo Area BIA Regional Director Deborah Shirley
  • 11/22/2023 – Missing and Murdered Diné Relatives Task Force selects voting members
  • 11/20/2023 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Missing and Murdered Dine’ Relatives Task Force partners with the Navajo Nation Police Department Missing Persons Unit for Missing Persons Day
  • 11/20/2023 –  Health, Education & Human Services Committee reviews amendments to the Navajo Nation Child Support Guidelines and Child Support Schedule
  • 11/20/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council encourages Elevate Navajo students to pursue financial literacy and continued education
  • 11/13/2023 – Resources and Development Committee approves Tsidi To’ii Chapter’s corrective action plan
  • 11/10/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council celebrates historic signing of the Navajo Nation Procurement Act amendments
  • 11/08/2023 – Navajo Nation leaders celebrate $2.1 million funding allocation for the Coyote Canyon Rehabilitation Center
  • 11/06/2023 – Resources and Development Committee certifies Manuelito Chapter’s Community-Based Land Use Plan
  • 11/06/2023 –  ‘Road to 16’ ends with $3 Million legislation signing for new residential building at Navajo Preparatory School
  • 11/06/2023 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Missing & Murdered Dine’ Relatives Task Force brings federal manpower to assist with MMDR crisis on the Navajo Nation
  • 11/01/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council joins President Nygren in signing a $50,000 appropriation for Hozho Center for Personal Enhancement homeless shelter

OCTOBER 2023

  • 10/26/2023 –  Navajo Utah Delegates advocate for the Navajo Mountain road project with Utah legislators
  • 10/26/2023 –  Navajo Agricultural Products Industry presents $1 million dividend payment to the Navajo Nation
  • 10/18/2023 – Navajo Nation Council supports funding for student housing for Navajo Preparatory School
  • 10/18/2023 –  Council approves $2.1 million to support patient care and rehabilitation services for disabled persons
  • 10/18/2023 – $5.6 million approved for Diné College and Navajo Technical University
  • 10/18/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council passes legislation to allow virtual attendance at chapter meetings
  • 10/17/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council approves purchase of Goulding’s Lodge using Land Acquisition Trust Fund
  • 10/17/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council approves funding to assist operations of homeless shelter
  • 10/17/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council welcomed the State of the Navajo Nation Address from President Nygren
  • 10/16/2023 – Arizona Secretary of State addresses the Navajo Nation and pledges to work for fair elections for tribal nations
  • 10/16/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council recognizes Domestic Violence Awareness Month
  • 10/13/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council to convene for Fall Council Session
  • 10/12/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council’s Naa’bik’íyáti’ Committee advances legislations to be considered during Fall Council Session

  • 10/10/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council condemns actions of Espanola shooter
  • 10/09/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council recognizes Indigenous Peoples’ Day and the contributions of Native Americans
  • 10/05/2023 – MMDR Task Force seeks voting members to address Navajo missing persons epidemic

  • 09/28/2023 – Council Delegate Damon obtains extensions for four New Mexico Tribal Infrastructure Fund projects

  • 09/21/2023 – Navajo Nation Council members meet with first Native American U.S. Treasurer Marilynn Malerba
  • 09/21/2023 – Navajo Nation Council Speaker Supports RECA Amendments to Address Legacy of Uranium Mining
  • 09/20/2023 –  Health, Education & Human Services Committee pushes for implementation of Data Sharing Agreement
  • 09/14/2023 – Law and Order Committee advocates on Capitol Hill for critical Navajo Nation Public Safety needs
  • 09/14/2023 –  Navajo Nation Human Rights Commission commemorates 10-year partnership with the U.S. Department of Justice’s Civil Rights Division focusing on addressing civil rights violations of Navajo citizens
  • 09/13/2023 –  Speaker Curley offers condolences to Congresswoman Peltola following the loss of her husband
  • 09/08/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council approves the Navajo Nation FY2024 Comprehensive Budget with priority funding for Navajo veterans, elders, public safety, and housing
  • 09/07/2023 – Speaker Curley applauds President Nygren’s signing of the historic Navajo Nation Victims Right Act of 2023
  • 09/04/2023 –  Budget & Finance Committee approves the Navajo Nation FY2024 Comprehensive Budget appropriating funding for veterans, elders, public safety, scholarships, and housing
  • 09/01/2023 – Law & Order Committee addresses the Diné Marriage Act, Navajo Procurement and Business Opportunity Acts, and public safety concerns

  • 08/29/2023 –  Historic christening of “USNS Navajo” Navy ship honors the service Navajo Veterans and the Navajo Code Talkers

  • 08/07/2023 – Navajo Nation Council commends signing of resolution to provide additional funding for Navajo veterans

  • 08/04/2023 – Ganado Chapter Waterline Extension Project will connect homes to running water
  • 08/02/2023 –  Health, Education & Human Services Committee approves legislation recognizing same-sex marriage on the Navajo Nation

  • 06/05/2023 – Council approves supplemental appropriations to cover Executive Branch FY2023 operating expenses
  • 06/02/2023 –  President Nygren and Speaker Curley express disappointment regarding Department of the Interior Secretary  Deb Haaland’s decision to withdraw lands surrounding Chaco Canyon National Historic Park from future leasing and mining claims

    JANUARY 2022

    • 12/17/18 –Navajo Nation Council’s three-day special session to be live-streamed
    • 12/17/18 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee special meeting on 12/18/2018 at 3:00pm (Council Chambers)

    • 12/13/18 –Council members commend the passage of the Farm Bill reauthorization

    JUNE 2017

    • 06/30/17 –Proposed agenda for Special Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 7/06/2017 at 1:00pm (DODE Auditorium)(REVISED 7/3/2017) (TIME CHANGE FROM 9:00am to 1:00pm)

    • 02/09/16 –Meeting with Governor Martinez focuses on Capital Outlay funding for Navajo communities

    • 02/08/16 –Council mourns the loss of former delegate Harry D. Brown, Sr.

    • 02/02/16 –Speaker Bates appoints Pete Ken Atcitty as Acting Chief of Staff

    • 02/01/16 –Naat’aji’ Nahat’a Hane’ – Legislative Branch News – 2016 Winter Council Session

    JANUARY 2016

    • 01/29/16 –Navajo Nation Council unanimously approves Nation’s largest spending package for water and sanitation projects

    • 01/27/16 –Navajo Nation Council approves use of funds for chapters, water line projects, and economic development projects

    • 01/27/16 –Navajo Nation Council approves the Utah Navajo Water Rights Agreement

    • 01/27/16 –Navajo Nation Council approves funds to address dilapidated Judicial facilities

    • 01/27/16 –Council unanimously approves Navajo Veterans Act

    • 01/26/16 –Speaker Bates calls for increased communication between the Nation’s three branches of government to move Nation forward

    • 01/25/16 –Approved agenda for Navajo Nation Council Winter Session on 1/25/2016 – 1/29/2016 at 10:00am

    • 01/25/16 –Speaker Bates’ report to 23rd Navajo Nation Council Winter Session on 1/25/2016

    • 01/25/16 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee special meeting on 1/25/2016 at 7:00am

    • 01/24/16 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee Executive session on 1/25/2016

    • 01/22/16 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee special meeting on 1/25/2016 at 7:00am

    • 01/22/16 –Navajo Nation Council to convene for the Winter Council Session

    • 01/22/16 –Proposed agenda for Navajo Nation Council Winter Session on 1/25/2016 – 1/29/2016 at 10:00am

    • 01/21/16 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 1/21/2016 at 10:00am

    • 01/21/16 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee work session on 1/22/2016 at 10:00am

    • 01/20/16 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 1/21/2016 at 10:00am

    • 01/19/16 –Budget and Finance Committee begin addressing potential budget shortfalls based on revenue projections report

    • 01/14/16 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 1/14/2016 at 10:00am

    • 01/14/16 –Initial expenditure plan for settlement funds focuses on water projects for Navajo communities

    • 01/13/16 –Council members express support for initiative to help homeless Navajo people

    • 01/13/16 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 1/14/2016 at 10:00am

    • 01/12/16 –Resources and Development Committee approves Navajo Nation business license regulations

    • 01/05/16 –Council confirms directors of Navajo Nation Environmental Protection Agency and Division of Transportation

    • 01/04/16 –Budget and Finance Committee receives report regarding the Gaming Net Revenues Distribution Fund

    NOVEMBER 2023

    • 11/10/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council celebrates historic signing of the Navajo Nation Procurement Act amendments
    • 11/08/2023 – Navajo Nation leaders celebrate $2.1 million funding allocation for the Coyote Canyon Rehabilitation Center
    • 11/06/2023 – Resources and Development Committee certifies Manuelito Chapter’s Community-Based Land Use Plan
    • 11/06/2023 –  ‘Road to 16’ ends with $3 Million legislation signing for new residential building at Navajo Preparatory School
    • 11/06/2023 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Missing & Murdered Dine’ Relatives Task Force brings federal manpower to assist with MMDR crisis on the Navajo Nation
    • 11/01/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council joins President Nygren in signing a $50,000 appropriation for Hozho Center for Personal Enhancement homeless shelter

    OCTOBER 2023

    • 10/26/2023 –  Navajo Utah Delegates advocate for the Navajo Mountain road project with Utah legislators
    • 10/26/2023 –  Navajo Agricultural Products Industry presents $1 million dividend payment to the Navajo Nation
    • 10/18/2023 – Navajo Nation Council supports funding for student housing for Navajo Preparatory School
    • 10/18/2023 –  Council approves $2.1 million to support patient care and rehabilitation services for disabled persons
    • 10/18/2023 – $5.6 million approved for Diné College and Navajo Technical University
    • 10/18/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council passes legislation to allow virtual attendance at chapter meetings
    • 10/17/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council approves purchase of Goulding’s Lodge using Land Acquisition Trust Fund
    • 10/17/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council approves funding to assist operations of homeless shelter
    • 10/17/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council welcomed the State of the Navajo Nation Address from President Nygren
    • 10/16/2023 – Arizona Secretary of State addresses the Navajo Nation and pledges to work for fair elections for tribal nations
    • 10/16/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council recognizes Domestic Violence Awareness Month
    • 10/13/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council to convene for Fall Council Session
    • 10/12/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council’s Naa’bik’íyáti’ Committee advances legislations to be considered during Fall Council Session
    • 10/11/2023 –  Navajo Hopi Land Commission presents priorities issues to Interim Navajo Hopi Land Commission Office Executive Director
    • 10/10/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council condemns actions of Espanola shooter
    • 10/09/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council recognizes Indigenous Peoples’ Day and the contributions of Native Americans
    • 10/05/2023 – MMDR Task Force seeks voting members to address Navajo missing persons epidemic

    SEPTEMBER 2023

    • 09/28/2023 – Council Delegate Damon obtains extensions for four New Mexico Tribal Infrastructure Fund projects
    • 09/27/2023 – Speaker Curley testifies before Congress in support of clean water access for the Navajo Nation
    • 09/26/2023 –  Council Delegates advocate for Mandatory Federal Aid and Public Safety Measures during White House meeting
    • 09/21/2023 – Navajo Nation Council members meet with first Native American U.S. Treasurer Marilynn Malerba
    • 09/21/2023 – Navajo Nation Council Speaker Supports RECA Amendments to Address Legacy of Uranium Mining
    • 09/20/2023 –  Health, Education & Human Services Committee pushes for implementation of Data Sharing Agreement
    • 09/14/2023 – Law and Order Committee advocates on Capitol Hill for critical Navajo Nation Public Safety needs
    • 09/14/2023 –  Navajo Nation Human Rights Commission commemorates 10-year partnership with the U.S. Department of Justice’s Civil Rights Division focusing on addressing civil rights violations of Navajo citizens
    • 09/13/2023 –  Speaker Curley offers condolences to Congresswoman Peltola following the loss of her husband
    • 09/08/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council approves the Navajo Nation FY2024 Comprehensive Budget with priority funding for Navajo veterans, elders, public safety, and housing
    • 09/07/2023 – Speaker Curley applauds President Nygren’s signing of the historic Navajo Nation Victims Right Act of 2023
    • 09/04/2023 –  Budget & Finance Committee approves the Navajo Nation FY2024 Comprehensive Budget appropriating funding for veterans, elders, public safety, scholarships, and housing
    • 09/01/2023 – Law & Order Committee addresses the Diné Marriage Act, Navajo Procurement and Business Opportunity Acts, and public safety concerns

    AUGUST 2023

    • 08/29/2023 –  Historic christening of “USNS Navajo” Navy ship honors the service Navajo Veterans and the Navajo Code Talkers
    • 08/29/2023 –  MEDIA ADVISORY:  Press conference announcing the passage of the “Navajo Nation Victim’s Rights Act of 2023”
    • 08/28/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council unanimously approves legislation to enact the “Navajo Nation Victim’s Rights Act of 2023”
    • 08/15/2023 –  Delegate Charles-Newton calls for increased partnership with federal government to address violence against Native American women
    • 08/09/2023 –  San Juan Mitigation Fund signed into law through legislation sponsored by Delegate Rickie Nez
    • 08/09/2023 –  Speaker Curley participates in tribal roundtable with Arizona Governor Hobbs
    • 08/08/2023 – Tribal leaders join President Biden for the designation of the Baaj Nwaavjo I’tah Kukveni – Ancestral Footprints of the Grand Canyon National Monument
    • 08/07/2023 – Navajo Nation Council commends signing of resolution to provide additional funding for Navajo veterans
    • 08/07/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council advocates for federal priorities at Tribal Interior Budget Council meeting
    • 08/04/2023 – Ganado Chapter Waterline Extension Project will connect homes to running water
    • 08/02/2023 –  Health, Education & Human Services Committee approves legislation recognizing same-sex marriage on the Navajo Nation

    JULY 2023

    • 07/28/2023 –  Navajo Nation Commission on Emergency Management declares an extreme heat State of Emergency
    • 07/28/2023 –  Law and Order Committee tours aftermath of Chinle flooding
    • 07/27/2023 –  U.S. Senate passes RECA bill as Navajo Nation leaders advocate on Capitol Hill to help former Navajo uranium miners and downwinders
    • 07/26/2023 –  Nast’ájí Nahat’á Hane’  – Legislative Branch Newsletter 2023 Summer Council Session
    • 07/21/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council supports in-person attendance at all standing committee meetings and council sessions
    • 07/21/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council approves amendment to the Sex Offenders Registration and Notification Act in Title 17 of the Navajo Nation Code
    • 07/20/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council approves the San Juan River Mitigation Fund to improve water quality for farmers affected by the Gold King Mine spill
    • 07/17/2023 –  Speaker Crystalyne Curley’s report to the 2023 Navajo Nation Council Summer Session
    • 07/17/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council Summer Session Speaker’s Report addresses priorities facing the Navajo Nation
    • 07/17/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council Delegates participate in Angels vs Drunk Drivers Walk to raise awareness against drunk driving
    • 07/17/2023 – Arizona Governor Katie Hobbs says she’ll work directly with the Navajo Nation on critical issues
    • 07/14/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council to welcome Arizona Governor Katie Hobbs to the Summer Council Session
    • 07/11/2023 – Resources and Development Committee offers support for Navajo allottees affected by the Chaco Canyon land withdrawal
    • 07/10/2023 – Council and Standing Committees return to in-person meetings with the lifting of the Covid-19 Public Health State of Emergency
    • 07/07/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council honors the life of esteemed Navajo weaver Helen Charley
    • 07/07/2023 –  Resources & Development Committee receives updates from Cameron Chapter
    • 07/06/2023 –  Eastern Navajo Land Commission receives report on Quivera Mine Site cleanup

    JUNE 2023

    • 06/27/2023 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee supports increased funding for Navajo veterans programs and services
    • 06/26/2023 –  Delegate Damon sponsors Legislation 0139-23 to repeal Title 9 of the Navajo Nation Code and recognize all marriages
    • 06/26/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council members push for safer roadway between Navajo Mountain and Oljato communities
    • 06/23/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council encourages tribal participation in the Not Invisible Act Commission public hearing
    • 06/22/2023 –  Navajo Nation Statement on the Supreme Court of the United States’ opinion of Arizona, Et Al. V. Navajo Nation
    • 06/21/2023 –  Budget and Finance Committee supports amendments to the Veterans Trust Fundto provide additional funding for Navajo veterans
    • 06/15/2023 –  President Nygren and Speaker Curley praise the Supreme Court decision in the ICWA case
    • 06/14/2023 –  Ganado Unified School District receives tablets to assist students without internet access
    • 06/12/2023 –  Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee receives report on NTUA’s Past Due Relief Program
    • 06/08/2023 – Navajo Nation leaders express disappointment with Department of the Interior’s scheduled celebration at Chaco Culture National Historic Park 
    • 06/07/2023 –  Non-renewal of lease forces closure of Arizona Department of Economic Security Window Rock office
    • 06/05/2023 – Council approves supplemental appropriations to cover Executive Branch FY2023 operating expenses
    • 06/02/2023 –  President Nygren and Speaker Curley express disappointment regarding Department of the Interior Secretary  Deb Haaland’s decision to withdraw lands surrounding Chaco Canyon National Historic Park from future leasing and mining claims

    MAY 2023

    • 05/19/2023 –  Law and Order Committee receives report on proposed alcohol and detox treatment centers
    • 05/18/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council and City of Gallup address reports of Navajo people being targeted by fraudulent rehab and treatment centers
    • 05/16/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council’s Budget & Finance Committee begins to eliminate red tape in the procurement process
    • 05/16/2023 – President Nygren and Speaker Curley advocate for the Navajo Nation at the Department of the Interior
    • 05/15/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council recognizes “National Peace Officers Memorial Day and Police Week” fallen Navajo Police Officers
    • 05/12/2023 – Navajo Nation mourns the loss of 101-year-old Diné World War II veteran Steven Harrison
    • 05/10/2023 –  Nast’ájí Nahat’á Hane’ – Legislative Branch Newsletter 2023 Spring Council Session
    • 05/09/2023 – 25th Navajo Nation Council honors the life of late Navajo leader Sampson Begay
    • 05/09/2023 – Navajo Nation Council congratulates new U.S. Department of Transportation Assistant Secretary for Tribal Affairs Arlando Teller
    • 05/08/2023 – Navajo Nation Council members receive input on the proposed San Juan River Mitigation Fund related to the Gold King Mine spill
    • 05/05/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council encourages members of the Navajo Nation to participate in the No Invisible Act Commission public hearing
    • 05/03/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council congratulates new Gallup Police Chief Erin Toadlena-Pablo, a member of the Navajo Nation and the first woman to serve in the position

    APRIL 2023

    • 04/27/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council members meet with Marilynn Malerba, the first Native American U.S. Treasurer
    • 04/25/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council approves legislation opposing the confirmation of New Mexico Indian Affairs Secretary-Designee James R. Mountain
    • 04/19/2023 –  $2 million approved by the 25th Navajo Nation Council for summer youth employment
    • 04/19/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council approves $1.5 million to support St. Michaels Association for Special Education
    • 04/17/2023 –  Navajo Nation Council Speaker Crystalyne Curley’s Quarterly Report to Navajo Nation Council 2023 Spring Session
    • 04/14/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council secures key positions under the Tribal Interior Budget Council

    MARCH 2023

    • 03/24/2023 – Delegate Damon receives report on capital outlay funding from the Deputy Secretary of New Mexico Indian Affairs
    • 03/22/2023 –  JOINT PRESS RELEASE: Navajo Nation pays tribute to the life and service of former Navajo Nation President Ben Shelly
    • 03/21/2023 – Navajo Nation leaders attend U.S. Supreme Court hearing in support of Arizona water claims
    • 03/20/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council commemorates the inaugural “Navajo Women Warriors Day”

    • 03/15/2023 – Council Delegate Amber Kanazbah Crotty applauds Red Valley-Cove High School students for Stock Market Game national ranking
    • 03/09/2023 – Navajo Nation Council honors the life of Diné World War II veteran Lillian Lincheze Lujan
    • 03/08/2023 –  Navajo Nation President Buu Nygren, Navajo Nation Council Speaker Crystalyne Curley express sympathy at loss of late President Peterson Zah
    • 03/07/2023 – Navajo Nation Council honors the life and service of longtime Diné leader Jack Chee Jackson, Sr.

    • 03/01/2023 –  25th Navajo Nation Council honors the life of Caleb Roanhorse

      JUNE 2022

      • 06/30/2022 – $1,070,298,867 Billion in American Rescue Plan Act funding approved for Water Pipelines, Electricity, Housing Construction, and Broadband Internet Projects by the Navajo Nation Council

      • 06/27/2022 –  Americans With Disabilities Act (ADA) regulations a top priority for the Law and Order Committee
      • 06/22/2022 –  Navajo Nation Leaders host roundtable discussion regarding Antelope Point Marina with the National Park Service

      MAY 2022

      • 05/27/2022 – Navajo Nation Memorial Week proclaimed by Speaker Seth Damon

      • 05/26/2022 –  Work Session to discuss Chapter Infrastructure Projects hosted by Council Delegate Vince James

      • 05/18/2022 –  JOINT PRESS RELEASE: Navajo Nation Leaders pay tribute to the life of former Navajo Area BIA Director Omar Bradley
      • 05/17/2022 –  The Navajo Nation honors the life of Army Veteran and former Sheep Springs Council Delegate Edward V. Jim, Sr.
      • 05/17/2022 – The Navajo Nation shares concern over the lack of communication by the National Park Service for safety upgrades at the Antelope Point Marina
      • 05/15/2022 –  The University of Arizona honors Louva Dahozy with Honorary Doctorate in Science
      • 05/12/2022 –  Navajo Nation Leaders celebrate 30 years of innovation and leadership at Navajo Preparatory School
      • 05/12/2022 –  Navajo Nation honors the life of community leader Ms. Marlene Burbank

      • 05/06/2022 –  Eleanor E. Roehrig Advocate Award recognizes years of service by Madam Chair Amber Kanazbah Crotty

      • 05/03/2022 –  National Missing or Murdered Indigenous Persons Webpage supported by the Navajo Nation

      APRIL 2022

      • 04/29/2022 –  Navajo Nation Leaders applaud the 2-year extension of the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act by the United States Senate
      • 04/29/2022 – Interior Department and Bureau of Land Management hear from Navajo Nation Leaders regarding protection for the Chaco Culture National Historical Park
      • 04/28/2022 –  Navajo Nation leaders applaud $76 Million Water Delivery Agreement for the future Navajo Code Talkers Museum
      • 04/27/2022 –  New investments to connect rural Navajo communities to fast, reliable internet a top priority for the Navajo Nation Council
      • 04/25/2022 –  JOINT PRESS RELEASE: Flags to be flown at half-staff in honor and remembrance of Army Veteran Natashike Jacob Bia
      • 04/21/2022 – Criminal Penalties for Vicious Dog and other Animal Attacks passed by the Navajo Nation Council
      • 04/19/2022 –  Annual D.U.I. Checkpoint hosted by the Peshlakai Family and Navajo Nation Council brings awareness to drunk driving
      • 04/18/2022 –  Speaker Seth Damon’s Quarterly Report to the Navajo Nation Council 2022 Spring Session
      • 04/15/2022 –  Annual D.U.I. Checkpoint to be hosted by the Peshlakai Family and Madam Chair Eugenia Charles-Newton in New Mexico
      • 04/15/2022 –  Navajo Nation honors the life of former Council Delegate Harry J. Willeto
      • 04/15/2022 –  Secretary Jennifer Granholm and Arizona Congressman Tom O’Halleran join the Navajo Nation Council for Renewable Energy Roundtable
      • 04/08/2022 – Navajo Nation applauds the historic confirmation of Ketanji Brown Jackson to the United States Supreme Court
      • 04/08/2022 – Navajo Nation honors the life of Community Leader and Former Arizona State Representative Daniel Peaches
      • 04/05/2022 –  Navajo Nation Council urges Executive Branch to compromise, $1.7 Billion in ARPA infrastructure funding ready to be allocated
      • 04/05/2022 –  Resources and Development Committee and Navajo Forestry Department to host Carbon Credits – LOCATION CHANGE
      • 04/01/2022 – Council Delegates advance a $1 Billion ARPA spending plan to decentralize Window Rock and continue empowering Navajo Chapter projects and infrastructure initiatives

      MARCH 2022

      • 03/30/2022 –  Resources and Development Committee and Navajo Forestry Department to host Carbon Credits Information Meeting

      • 03/27/2022 – Navajo Water Rights funding for the Justice Department sponsored by Council Delegate Thomas Walker Jr.
      • 03/25/2022 –  Veterans Administration recommendation could harm Veteran services in New Mexico objected by Navajo Nation leaders
      • 03/19/2022 – Lack of Tribal Consultation by the Interior Department regarding Chaco Canyon a major concern for Navajo Nation leaders
      • 03/17/2022 –  Dr. Patricia Nez Henderson recognized by the Navajo Nation for being elected President of the Society for Research on Nicotine and Tobacco

      • 03/16/2022 – Reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act applauded by Navajo Nation leaders

      • 03/09/2022 –  The Navajo Nation Council and Utah Lieutenant Governor Deidre Henderson discuss infrastructure and COVID-19 recovery priorities
      • 03/09/2022 –  Navajo Nation Council applauds the nomination of Roselyn Tso as director of the Indian Health Service
      • 03/03/2022 –  JOINT PRESS RELEASE:  Navajo Nation leaders pay tribute to the life and service of retired Judge Carol K. Perry
      • 03/01/2022 –  Missing and Murdered Diné Relatives awareness walk hosted in Kayenta by Navajo Nation Council
      • 03/01/2022 – Indian Affairs Assistant Secretary Bryan Newland welcomed by Navajo Nation Leaders

      JULY 2017

      • 07/31/17 –Media Advisory: Acting chief justice to be sworn-in
      • 07/31/17 –Budget and Finance Committee receives report regarding energy development and manufacturing proposal from Indian Energy
      • 07/31/17 –Navajo Nation Council advocates for increase in federal funding to complete the Navajo Indian Irrigation Project
      • 07/28/17 –Navajo Preference in Employment Act Sub-Committee Public Hearing Schedule
      • 07/27/17 –Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee approves the purchase of ranch land in Colorado with the Land Acquisition Trust Fund
      • 07/27/17 –Resources and Development Committee considers recommendations to remove two division directors (REVISED 7/27/2017)
      • 07/27/17 –Navajo Nation Council members seek to bridge telecommunication gaps for public safety on the Navajo Nation
      • 07/25/17 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee special meeting on 7/25/2017 at 1:00pm at Twin Arrows Navajo Resort and Casino, Twin Arrows, AZ
      • 07/24/17 –Council Delegate Seth Damon welcomes the New Mexico Indian Affairs Commission to Chichiltah Chapter
      • 07/24/17 –Naat’aji Nahat’a Hane’ – Legislative Branch News: 2017 Summer Council Session
      • 07/24/17 –Perry Charley confirmed by Council to serve on the Dine’ Uranium Remediation Advisory Commission
      • 07/24/17 –New Mexico State Legislators invite Speaker Bates to present Navajo Nation priorities and initiatives
      • 07/21/17 –Navajo Nation Council confirms two new members to the gaming board
      • 07/21/17 –Council amends criminal code to combat human trafficking
      • 07/20/17 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee special meeting on 7/25/2017 at 1:00pm Twin Arrows Navajo Resort and Casino, Twin Arrows, AZ
      • 07/20/17 –Council approves funding increase for Navajo Technical College and Dine’ College
      • 07/20/17 –Council confirms two appointments to the Commission on Navajo Government Development
      • 07/18/17 –Speaker LoRenzo Bates delivers report on the opening day of the Summer Council Session
      • 07/17/17 –Speaker Bates’ report to the 2017 Navajo Nation Council Summer Session on 7/17/2017
      • 07/17/17 –Approved agenda for Navajo Nation Council Summer Session on 7/17/2017 – 7/21/2017 at 10:00am
      • 07/17/17 –Law and Order Committee advocates for improved benefits for spouses and children of late Navajo Nation police officers
      • 07/17/17 –Navajo Nation Council welcomes horse riders, youth groups and community advocates to start the Summer Council Session
      • 07/14/17 –Proposed agenda for Navajo Nation Council Summer Session on 7/17/2017 – 7/21/2017 at 10:00am (Council Chambers, Window Rock, AZ)
      • 07/13/17 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee Special Meeting on 7/14/2017 at 3:00pm (NDOT, Tse Bonito, NM)
      • 07/13/17 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee Special Meeting on 7/13/2017 at 9:00am (DODE Auditorium)

      • 07/10/17 –Approved agenda for Navajo Nation Council Special Session on 7/10/2017 at 1:00pm (DODE Auditorium)

      • 07/06/17 –Proposed agenda for Navajo Nation Council Special Session on 7/10/2017 at 1:00pm (DODE Auditorium)
      • 07/06/17 –Approved agenda for Special Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 7/06/2017 at 1:00pm (DODE Auditorium)

      • 07/03/17 –Navajo Nation Council pays tribute to the life of former delegate Peterson Becenti Yazzie
      • 07/03/17 –Council commends approval of $2.2 million for summer youth employment

      • 06/02/17 –Delegate Kee Allen Begay seeks support to amend the Navajo Nation Veterans Act to improve services for Navajo veterans

      • 03/24/16 – Council approves $1.7 million for the Tsidi To ii Chapter powerline extension project

      • 03/23/16 –Approved agenda for Navajo Nation Council Special Session on 3/23/2016 at 10:00am

      • 03/22/16 – Law and Order Committee approves Intergovernmental Agreement between the Navajo Nation and city of Page

      • 03/18/16 –Special Session to be held to address several legislation

      • 03/18/16 –Proposed agenda for Navajo Nation Council Special Session on 3/23/2016 at 10:00am

      • 03/17/16 –Budget and Finance Committee receives recommendations from the Auditor General to sanction Bahastl’a’a’ Chapter and Naa’tsis’Aa’n Chapter

      • 03/15/16 –Proposed agenda for Navajo Nation Council – Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee work session on 3/17/2016 at 10:00am

      • 03/15/16 –Law and Order Committee receives report from Navajo Division of Public Safety regarding initiatives of public safety

      • 03/15/16 –Iyanbito community receives equipment to improve and maintain roads

      • 03/11/16 –Council members tour Many Farms irrigation systems and farm areas

      • 03/11/16 –Delegate Begay urges BIE to aid the Navajo Nation to renovate and construct teacher and staff housing

      • 03/10/16 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Commmittee meetingon 3/10/2016 at 10:00am

      • 03/09/15 –Navajo Nation concerned over Hopi settlement agreement with the City of Flagstaff

      • 03/08/15 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 03/10/2016 at 10:00am

      • 03/07/15 –Announcement and Petition for Navajo Nation Council Special Session on 03/23/2016 at 10:00am

      • 03/02/16 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 3/2/2016 at 10:00am (REVISED 3/2/2016)

      • 03/01/16 –Council members meet with key officials on education, repatriation of sacred items and amending the Navajo-Hopi Land Settlement Act

      FEBRUARY 2016

      • 02/29/16 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Commmittee meeting on 3/02/2016 at 10:00am

      • 02/29/16 –Council moves forward with efforts to complete the Navajo Indian Irrigation Project

      • 02/29/16 –State Task Force applauds approval of $1.1 million for new Department of Economic Security facility in Chinle

      • 02/26/16 –Navajo Nation Council moves to aquire additional funds to supplement $180 million water and sanitation system projects

      • 02/24/16 –Announcement memo for Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 3/2/2016 at 10:00am

      • 02/22/16 –Law and Order Committee seeks applicants for the Judicial Conduct Commission

      • 02/22/16 –Budget and Finance Committee addresses chapter audit issues

      • 02/19/16 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Commmittee meeting on 2/19/2016 at 1:00pm

      • 02/18/16 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Commmittee meeting on 2/19/2016 at 1:00pm

      • 02/17/16 –Navajo Nation successfully advocates for the use of a “Certificate of Indian Blood” to establish identification at state level

      • 02/16/16 –Navajo Nation Council continues to advocate for funding through New Mexico legislative bills

      • 02/16/16 –Council members commend approval of Navajo Nation Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act amendments and Supreme Court funding

      • 02/13/16 –Announcement of Naa’bik’iyati’ Committee meeting on 2/19/2016 at 1:00pm

      • 02/12/16 – Council commends fallen Navajo Firefighter, Ramsey James

      • 02/12/16 – Naabik’iyátí’ Committee recommends approval of $1.6 million for renovation of homes in the Former Bennett Freeze Area

      • 02/12/16 –Navajo Nation issues support for Arizona Proposition 123 to provide funds for Navajo schools

      • 02/12/16 –Council leadership garners support for Utah Navajo initiatives

      • 02/11/16 –Approved agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Commmittee meeting on 2/11/2016 at 10:00am (REVISED 2/11/2016)

      • 02/09/16 –Proposed agenda for Naa’bik’iyati’ Commmittee meeting on 2/11/2016 at 10:00am

      • 02/09/16 –Meeting with Governor Martinez focuses on Capital Outlay funding for Navajo communities

      • 02/08/16 –Council mourns the loss of former delegate Harry D. Brown, Sr.

      • 02/02/16 –Speaker Bates appoints Pete Ken Atcitty as Acting Chief of Staff

      • 02/01/16 –Naat’aji’ Nahat’a Hane’ – Legislative Branch News – 2016 Winter Council Session

      JANUARY 2016

      • 01/29/16 –Navajo Nation Council unanimously approves Nation’s largest spending package for water and sanitation projects

      • 01/27/16 –Navajo Nation Council approves use of funds for chapters, water line projects, and economic development projects

      • 01/27/16 –Navajo Nation Council approves the Utah Navajo Water Rights Agreement

      • 01/27/16 –Navajo Nation Council approves funds to address dilapidated Judicial facilities

      • 01/27/16 –Council unanimously approves Navajo Veterans Act

      • 01/26/16 –Speaker Bates calls for increased communication between the Nation’s three branches of government to move Nation forward
